clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship of Retinal and Visual Cortex Structure and Visual Acuity After Congenital Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship of Retinal and Visual Cortex Structure and Visual Acuity After Congenital Cataract Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the influence of the visual acuity after congenital surgery on the retinal and visual cortex structure.

detailed_description.textblock: According to the visual acuity after congenital cataract surgery, 30 patients are divided into 3 groups.SD-OCT and MRI were used to measure the parameters of the retina and the visual cortex, to compare the differences between different groups, and to analyze the relationship between the structure of the retina and the visual cortex and visual acuity.

primary_outcome.description: Scan the 3.0mm diameter ETDRS ring area in the macular area with SD-OCT.
Scan the Subfoveal choroid in enhanced scan mode with SD-OCT.
Scan concentric circles with a length of 3.4mm and a diameter ranging from 2.5mm to 4.0mm in 12 directions centered on the optic disc with SD-OCT.

primary_outcome.measure: The volume of the lateral geniculate body
primary_outcome.description: Measure the volume of the lateral geniculate body by T1 phase scan of MRI

primary_outcome.measure: The volume of the brodmann 17,18,19 area
primary_outcome.description: Masure the volume of the brodmann 17,18,19 area by T1 phase scan of MRI

primary_outcome.measure: The FA of the white matter fiber bundle
primary_outcome.description: Measure the Fraction Anisotropy of the white matter fiber bundle related to visual signal transduction by DWI scan of MRI

arm_group.description: The BCVA of eyes is greater than 0.6
The BCVA of eyes is from 0.1 to 0.6
The BCVA of eyes is less than 0.6

study_pop.textblock: Patients with congenital cataract and were informed about their inclusion in the study and provided written consent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age of 4-60 years
- Congenital cataract surgery is planned
- The operation was successful without any complications
- Can cooperate well with OCT and MRI examinations
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intraoperative and postoperative complications include glaucoma, retinal, corneal, or refractive medium diseases
- Behavioral, cognitive impairment
- Developmental delay
